> With the power on, Salveo had gotten back on the control station and bega=
n programming the base's system for their access codes.=A0 Suddenly, the tr=
ansmission from Legacy came through, startling him.
>
> "Legacy, we copy.=
=A0 Where is the attack coming from?=A0 Is this an Unicronian attack?" he s=
aid into the radio.

Legacy paused as he accessed the situation and then sp=
oke,
"Affirmative, it is indeed a Unicronian that approaches. His energy
si=
gnature most closely matches that of Marauder, a minion of immense
power an=
d ability." Legacy paused once more before continuing, "I have
conflicting =
reports of him having at least 8 if not more forms."

I am replaying his la=
st transmission, ""You have what is mine!" "You
will release your minion ca=
ptive, or you will be destroyed!"

Meanwhile up above them Marauder continu=
ed his approach . . .

Giant wings beat the air lazily as he dropped out of=
 the skies. His
body was well defended, covered as it were in thick ice blu=
e and black
armored plates. His entire frame was thick and powerful, mute
t=
estimony to his function, to bring war and destruction! Powerful
claws hung=
 not only from his feet but also from the tips of his wings
ready to snatch=
 and rend anything that close enough. Behind him,
Marauder's powerful long =
tail trailed, looking ready smash and crush,
although the rear most section=
 almost looked as if it could retract to
extend perhaps a cannon, or a blad=
e. However to his front was perhaps
his more unique feature. Instead of a s=
ingle draconic head, there were
two, both of them grinning as the great bea=
st descended!

(OOC: I reposted Maruader's last entrance description into t=
he skies
over the old Maximal base to keep it current.)

Preston
(Marauder)=
